item.title: Shein Haul and Review
item.description:
Hello lovelies,

I am back again and this time with my Shein shopping and its review.

Who doesn't like to shop online? Myntra, Amazon, Flipkart are really popular online shopping websites for Indians. But when it comes to fashion, it becomes quite difficult to shop online as we need to
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
Hello lovelies,

I am back again and this time with my Shein shopping and its review.

Who doesn't like to shop online? Myntra, Amazon, Flipkart are really popular online shopping websites for Indians. But when it comes to fashion, it becomes quite difficult to shop online as we need to be really careful about size and material.

Have you ever thought about making a purchase from Shein?? Shein is really making it's name big among girls these days. Those who don't know what Shein is, let me introduce you to it.

What is Shein?
It is a fashion website which offers a wide variety of trendy clothing at affordable rate. So for my birthday, I decided to order something from Shein as the dresses and accessories on Shein always attracts me. So almost a week before my birthday, I placed an order.

So without wasting any time, lets have a look on my products from Shein.

What I bought?

  1. Yellow cut and sew dress:
     I was looking for some casual dresses so I bought this bright yellow color casual dress in just Rs. 595. I must tell you, material and quality is far better than my expectations, especially at this price.

2. Scallop laser cut dress:
This one is also casual dress. I just loved the color of this dress so I bought this without having second thought and bought it at Rs. 390. It fits well and difficult to find such elegant dress at this price.

3. Bow Detail Flounce Sleeve Keyhole Back Blouse:
This is simple yet beautiful top. These flounce sleeves are so in fashion these days. I bought this at just Rs. 495 and it fits as per my likeness. Material is very soft and it is a perfect winter top for me (though in Hyderabad, climate is never so cold).

4. Gold Plated Suede Cord Drop Earrings:
Got this in just Rs. 130 to wear on the yellow dress, in addition it doesn't look cheap and has good built quality.

5.  Faux Pearl Decorated Half Circle Stud Earrings:
I paired these with maroon top. These earrings are amazingly beautiful. These are also of Rs. 130. I bet you won't get such good quality in this amount.


6. Feather & Leaf Embellished Drop Earrings:
I bought these to pair it with blue dress in the same amount at Rs. 130. They totally exceeded my expectations as these looks beautiful with the dress.

7.  Faux Pearl Detail Long Drop Earrings:
I am in love with these earrings. These are super elegant,classy and of amazing quality at just Rs. 60. Cant wait to wear them!

How to select size of products?
Selecting a size is dilemma when it comes to online shopping, same goes with Shein. Trick part about buying on Shein- you might need to buy different sizes for different products like my dresses are of size L but top is of size M. So you need to check sizing details of every product as they are totally different. So go and get your measuring tape. It will help a ton to decide your correct size.

Reviews are your friend:
Reading reviews from actual buyers on Shein is the most important thing. It is a great help to decide purchasing the product as you will get an idea about size,material,quality and packaging. I never buy anything before reading it's reviews. Reviews at Shein render authentic and are pretty spot on.

About delivery of the product:
Quoted delivery of my producst was 2 to 3 weeks. But to my surprise, they delivered the products within a week. I was lucky to got my products delivered so early. But it is not the case always. You need to be really very patient if you want to buy from Shein. Because as per the reviews on internet, Shein take at least 2 weeks for delivery.

Quality of the product:
I ordered the products from Shein without any expectations. But quality of each product really surprised me and they are beautiful and amazing. I am totally satisfied and happy with my shopping experience with Shein.

What to buy from Shein:
Shein has really nice and chic collection of dresses. You must check out their dresses collection. And I bet you can't resist ordering them.
Also, it has a beautiful and big collection of accessories and that too at great price!

My overall experience:
I am really very impressed with Shein. The website is very easy to use and user friendly. They have an app, and it's even easier. Multiple payment options are available, but I opted for COD as I was shopping for the first time on Shein. Almost everyday they have some discounts,so you can bag amazing products at discounted price.
P.S.- I bought during offers.

Will I buy again from Shein?
I have had a great experience of Shein. Every single item I bought has a good quality,and it fits me well. So definitely I will buy again from Shein rather my cart is already filled with 3-4 more products. So if you are bored of same type of dresses or tops and looking for something trendy just go for Shein.

Shein was something I always wanted to try, so I hope this helps others who are considering buying from them!

Have a great week ahead!XOXO

item.title: Magical Swiss Paris: Switzerland
item.description:
Last week's post was all about Paris. This time I came with a blog post of Switzerland journey. If you haven't read my Paris journey experience, you can read that here.

Day 4 in Switzerland : Early morning ,we started our road trip to Switzerland. Scenic views and green lush on
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
Last week's post was all about Paris. This time I came with a blog post of Switzerland journey. If you haven't read my Paris journey experience, you can read that here.

Day 4 in Switzerland : Early morning ,we started our road trip to Switzerland. Scenic views and green lush on both the sides of the road made our journey unforgettable. This was our most colorful road trip ever.

Our destination was Basel. We reached there around 6 in the evening. Basel is truly a city of best architecture. It is such a quite,well organized city. It wasn't dark until very late in the night so we took a stroll nearby hotel.

Day 5 in Switzerland : After Swiss breakfast, we started our journey to Grindelwald by coach. Grindelwald is a picture perfect small mountain village in the Switzerland.

We took a cogwheel train from Grindelwald to Kleine scheidegg and from Kleine scheidegg to Jungfroujoch. This journey takes around an hour to reach Jungfroujoch. The view all the way up and down Jungfroujoch is spectacular and picturesque.

Peaks of snow mountains are forever fascinating.

Apart from ice peaks, there are so many other things to do there like visiting museum, walking through ice caves, skiing, experiencing food at famous Indian restaurant "Bollywood". Jungfroujoch was heavenly experience. This is a must visit place in Switzerland.

On our return journey from kleine scheidegg to Basel,we took a stop at Interlaken town. This town is famous for Yash Chopra movies and his bronze statue. This small town village is between the two lakes namely lake Brianze and lake Thun and hence the name Interlaken which means in between the lakes.

It is truly a treat to eyes as it is surrounded by snow mountains and filled with lush greenery and beautiful flowers.

Day 6  in Switzerland : We started this day with a trip to lake Brianze which is located in the east of Interlaken and it gives you a glimpse of Bernese Oberland mountains.

This lake is extra ordinary clean and turquoise in color. It is so clean that no fishes can survive in it. We took one hour spectacular and thrilling jet boat ride in the lake.

Later this day, we traveled to Lucerne city which is known for its old architecture. Lion monument and kapell bridge are some of the attractions of Lucerne city.

Then we took a walk around the shopping area. As I was in Switzerland ,I just couldn't miss a chance to buy some souvenirs, Swiss cow bell and of course world famous Swiss chocolates.

Day 7  in Switzerland : On day 7,we went to see Mount Titlis to experience yet another memorable day. We started from Basel to Engelberg and from there we took a gondola cable car to Trusbee.

And from Trusbee, we took a world's first 360 degree revolving cable car ride to Mount Titlis. It was once in a lifetime experience. We were literally spellbound by seeing beautiful snow mountain peaks.

Ice flyer chair lift, glacier cave, Titlis cliff walk are top attractions on mount Mitlis. On top of this,there is Movenpick Swiss ice cream shop to have lip smacking ice cream in such a cold icy weather.

On our return journey, we took a stop at Rhine Falls. Rhine fall near Schaffhausen on the Swiss-German border is Europe’s largest waterfall. We took a 15 mins boat ride over there and the experience was just amazing.

We directly took a road to Olten on our return journey.

Last day in Switzerland : We wake up early in the morning and we took a morning walk around our hotel area.

We check out from hotel after breakfast and we went to see Lake Zurich. We were fortunate that we got to spend our morning at Lake zurich as the environment there was quite and cool.

We spend our afternoon at Bahnhofstrasse. Bahnhofstrasse is Zurich's main downtown street and one of the world's most expensive and exclusive shopping avenues. Many of the world’s luxury brands such as Jimmy Choo, Prada, Chanel shop houses are there on Bahnhofstrasse. Bahnhofstrasse means “main train street” in German.

It is one of Zurich’s most beautiful streets with many big Swiss banks are located on it. We took a small walk around the street as we have to left for airport for our return flight to India.

This was one of the most memorable trips we had.

I will soon meet you with another exciting blog. Have a great week ahead!

item.title: Magical Swiss Paris:Paris
item.description:
This year in June we did Europe tour for 8 days in which we visited France and Switzerland. As expected both the destinations are astonishing and breathtaking. Paris is such a beauty and Switzerland is truly worth all the hype.

There is no doubt Paris is a fashion capital of
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
This year in June we did Europe tour for 8 days in which we visited France and Switzerland. As expected both the destinations are astonishing and breathtaking. Paris is such a beauty and Switzerland is truly worth all the hype.

There is no doubt Paris is a fashion capital of the world. Most of the high end fashion brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior, Chanel,Hermes are headquartered in Paris. Paris is a city of light, love, art, fashion, gastronomy and culture.

So this week's post is all about Swiss France throwback tour.

  1. Day 1 in Paris : On the first day we landed Paris at around 5 in the evening. That day after dinner we decided to visit Eiffel Tower as I couldn't wait more to visit it and also its one of the most romantic and attractive places in the world. Every night,every hour on the hour,Landmark of the Paris lights up with 20,000 twinkly golden bulbs and sparkles for five minutes,and looks even more beautiful and enchanting. But sadly,it's illegal to share, sell, or publish photos and videos of the night-lit Eiffel Tower.
  2. Day 2 in Paris : On our second day, We again went to see day view of Eiffel tower and we went up to the second floor. View from there was just amazing and stunning. After seeing this beauty I realized, why millions of people visit Eiffel tower every year.

Later on this day,we did city tour by hop on hop off bus which included Arc de Triomph, Notre Dame Cathedral, Champ de Mars,Opera Garnier, Louvre Pyramide, Champs-Elysees, Alexander bridge and Invalide￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼s.

Another exciting stop was at Fragonard museum for which I was waiting for long. Fragonard is a French perfume house and makes their products in their own factory and it is quite interesting to visit their museum with guided tour. It is a huge museum cum store with varieties of products ranging from perfumes to creams to soaps.

And on this evening ,we did Seine river cruise ride. This river flows through the city and you can observe famous attractions and capture the memories- Orsay Museum, Eiffel Tower, Alexander Bridge and Notre Dame Cathedral. You can enjoy city skyline through this cruise ride.


3.Day 3 in Paris : On the third day, we visited the world famous Disney Theme Park which is full of fun, adventure and entertainment. This was our second visit to Disney park after HongKong, so we knew what to expect. From thrill rides to family adventures, there's plenty to explore at Disneyland Paris. The Parks are packed with Disney attractions and unforgettable experiences. Its every kid's dream to visit Disneyland once in lifetime. Even though we spend entire day there, we wanted to stay there for some more time.

Later in the evening, we went to see world famous Lido show. Its a breathtaking show with talented performers,Graceful choreography, fascinating acrobats and technical prowess. This spectacular show is a true ode to the City of Lights.

On day 4, we bid goodbye to Paris-the city of love with lots of memories and we embarked on our journey to Switzerland. Stay tuned till I share my Swiss experience. Have a nice weekend ahead. XOXO!

item.title: DIY : Decoupage Bottle Art
item.description:
Hello folks.. what are you up to?

I hope you all are doing good.

This week's post is about DIY home decor. Most people throw away their sauce,honey,beer or wine bottles once they finished it. But you can turn those empty bottles into unique and colorful piece of
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
Hello folks.. what are you up to?

I hope you all are doing good.

This week's post is about DIY home decor. Most people throw away their sauce,honey,beer or wine bottles once they finished it. But you can turn those empty bottles into unique and colorful piece of art.

There are various ways to decorate glass bottles or jars. You can simply paint on it using glass colors or acrylic colors. Or you can use decoupage method to decorate it. Else you can do mural art or mix media art on it.

Decoupage is an art of pasting paper cutouts on surface and then decorating it with glitters,lace,thread or any other decorative material.

Any type of paper can be used for decoupage art like craft paper, magazine or newspaper cut outs, colorful tissue papers,wrapping paper or thin fabric and of course decoupage paper.

So let's see how I made this bottle corner piece at home.

Material I used:

Bottle,Decoupage paper, Modpodge glue,brush to apply modpodge and scissor.

1. First cut the paper in small pieces.

2. Then I applied modpodge glue on bottle and immediately pasted my cutouts on bottle.

3. After pasting all cutouts on the bottle, lastly I smoothed out the creases by applying another layer of modpodge on bottle. And then kept it to dry for 2-3 hours.

Tan ta da.... Here is my decoupage glass bottle. Just place it in any corner of your house with flowers sticks in it or decorate it with fairy lights or small table lamps beside it.

One more decoupage bottle with different design.

Have a happy week fellas! see you next week!

P.S. : You can further decorate it with other embellishment such as lace,woolen thread,artificial flowers or ribbon.

item.title: My Experience: Balayage Hair Coloring at Home
item.description:
Hair highlights, Balayage changes your look dramatically. It is a great way to refresh your appearance and try something new. Whether you opt coloring all over or highlights or balayage, it will accentuate the beauty of your hair.

Every now n then, I get bored with my hair look. So
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
Hair highlights, Balayage changes your look dramatically. It is a great way to refresh your appearance and try something new. Whether you opt coloring all over or highlights or balayage, it will accentuate the beauty of your hair.

Every now n then, I get bored with my hair look. So I always look for something new to try on my hair. I have tried highlights thrice. And I really liked my look.

April this year, I again started looking for something new to change my look as I was going to attend 2-3 family functions in Pune. So I went to a very popular salon in Kothrud area Pune. And I spend quite a good amount just to highlight my hair. And I was so upset with the result. Anyone could hardly see any difference on my hair. I was not at all satisfied with my so-called new look. And after 2 months it almost faded away.

So after this experience,I decided to color my hair at home by myself because I didn't want to spend same amount again in just 2 months. I searched umpteen number of sites,videos from how to choose hair color according to your hair and skin tone to how to apply hair color at home. I gathered all the courage and ordered Revlon Colorsilk beautiful hair color (Medium Blonde No-74) from Amazon.

This is absolutely ammonia free product. It comes with ammonia free Colorant, developer,after-color conditioner,plastic gloves and instruction leaflet.

I wanted balayage look for my hair. I applied the color and kept it for almost 1.15 hrs. I used broad tooth vented hair brush and hair coloring brush for application. After wash,my hair got lighten but not as per my expectations. So again I applied color which was left after first application and kept it for 1 hr. After second wash,there was a dramatic change in my hair color. And I was so relieved and happy with the result. Let me tell you this,my hair is jet black in color. So it's quit difficult to lighten my hair without bleach.

Some pointers based on my experience:

  1. Go for ammonia free product.
  2. First decide what color you want for your look,check your skin tone,natural hair color and accordingly purchase product. And for this,don't trust on the picture shown on hair color box. You will never get same color as shown on the box.
  3. If you have a deep black hair like me,go literally for blonde shades. Blonde shade gives you at least shade closer to brown or light brown. Else Red or Burgundy gives you nice shade.
  4. Likewise choose color carefully by referring shade card.
  5. Do a patch test before using color on your skin.
  6. Dont apply color on roots for highlights or balayage look. Start coloring by leaving 3-4 inches from roots.
  7. Balayage is a free-form method of hair coloring. You don't need aluminium foil for this,you just need to apply color in a sweeping motion.
  8. The Balayage sweeps should be very close and soft leading to a thicker highlights at the ends of the hair.

My hair look before coloring but with slight highlights from previous salon visit.

So this is my final look. I have done this almost 2 months back. Hair color always look different and lighter in natural light. So test your experiment in natural light.

That’s about it for my hair update. I hope you guys enjoyed and it gave you some idea if you’re wanting to change your look! Talk to you very soon. Good Day!

Disclaimer:
Above write-up and tips are totally based on my personal experience. I am not a professional hair stylist. But I like to try everything by myself so I tried this at home. I suggest you to search thoroughly before doing this at home.

item.title: DIY: Designer saree with fabric painting and lace work
item.description:
Humans have been painting on fabric for thousands of years. Fabric painting is one of the ways to add colors and life to your boring, dull and plain clothes. There are number of techniques to paint on fabric.

I always had a fascination about fabric painting. When I was in
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
Humans have been painting on fabric for thousands of years. Fabric painting is one of the ways to add colors and life to your boring, dull and plain clothes. There are number of techniques to paint on fabric.

I always had a fascination about fabric painting. When I was in 7th standard, I first tried fabric painting on my Kurti and then I went on trying different techniques of fabric painting. One of my favorite techniques is free hand fabric painting. For this technique, you don't need to trace any design on fabric. You just need to fill brush with good amount of color and paint away. But before starting free hand painting on fabric, you must have design in your mind. You can use single color for this or can use 2-3 colors to have shading effect. Some basic tips for fabric painting:

  1. Pre-washing the fabric is not always required but it is recommended to remove any starch or sizing added during manufacturing.
  2. Iron the fabric after washing to paint smoothly on it.
  3. Always use cardboard or notebook to place underneath the fabric to prevent it from bleeding through the fabric.
  4. If you are not confident about directly painting on fabric, you can always trace a design on fabric by fabric chalk or using carbon paper.
  5. If you made any mistake while painting, don't worry, try lifting it out immediately by dry brush and then clean it with wet wipes or wet cloth.
  6. Even if color gets dried out before cleaning it, you can use Nail paint remover to remove dried paint. Just dip cotton ear bud in nail paint remover and rub it on cloth until the color gets removed from the cloth.
  7. Wait for 24 hours after painting. And then you can iron it from back side of painting.

This is my free hand painting on saree. I got this saree as a gift from my sister-in-law on last Diwali. And from then I was thinking whether to make it heavy designer saree by attaching Jardosi border or make it simple just by painting on it. And I decided to paint on it as it would give me chance to explore my creativity.

Flowers are such a divine creations. They instantly gives you colorful life and positive energy. So I thought of painting flowers on saree. This is light lemon yellow colored soft chiffon saree. I have used Acrylic Deep Bril Purple-64 ,Camel Fabrica Acrylic ultra White color and Faber Castle 6 no brush for flowers and Acrylic Sap Green-21 color and Faber Castle 0 no brush for leaves. I repeated the design randomly all over the saree.

But after I completed my painting work, I realised that this saree is very light in weight. So it will be difficult to drape it properly as it will not get a nice fall. So I attached a simple pearl border to add little weight to saree. And here is my saree ready with fabric painting and lace work at home.

I wore this saree for one small family function with hot pink bot neck blouse and long kundan earrings,some bangles and then completed my look with off white colored heels.

You can always change something simple, plain into an attractive piece with little creativity and efforts. Let me know what you all think about this. Have a happy week ahead. XOXO!

item.title: My Lookbook on Skirts
item.description: We all know that white t shirt, blue jeans and LBD (Little Black Dress) are something every woman must have in her wardrobe. But don't forget to have skirts too in your wardrobe. Skirts always give you feminine feel and look whether you go for flared skirt or denim skirt.
item.dc:creator: Priyanka
item.content:encoded:
We all know that white t shirt, blue jeans and LBD (Little Black Dress) are something every woman must have in her wardrobe. But don't forget to have skirts too in your wardrobe. Skirts always give you feminine feel and look whether you go for flared skirt or denim skirt.

Skirts come in all shapes,sizes and cuttings. So difficult task is to find best skirt which suits you and compliments your body type.

Here are my personal favorite skirts from my wardrobe.

1.Pencil Skirt:

Whenever I am in doubt about what to wear,I wear pencil skirt. No matter what mood I have, I always feel beautiful and confident in pencil skirt. This black and white skirt is of Splash. I paired it with sleeveless black top with little sequin work on it. This is a perfect party outfit. I completed my outfit with Catwalk heels.

2. A-line skirt:

A-line skirts must be everyone's favorite as these are not too long and not too short and just perfect for dinner night. These skirts also compliments everyone's body.

This is my favorite as I have a big obsession of floral patterns. I paired this skirt with solid black crop top. Both skirt and top bought from Singapore Bugis street market. And I always wear my statement neck piece with it.

3. Flared skirt:

If you have those unduly and unwanted bulges then these skirts are perfect to hide those and give you a smart,stylish and girl next door look.

I have this navy blue plain flared skirt from Westside which I paired with soft baby pink striped crop top again from Westside. This casual look is perfect for any college going girl. I completed my look with pointed ballet shoes from Street Style Store.

4.Mini Skirt:

Mini skirts are best outfit for your girl's day out in summer. It gives you smart,gorgeous look and help you beat the heat in summer.

I have this mini skirt from Ginger Lifestyle with all feminine colors on it. I wore this with sheer Lace blue top from Forever 21 .

5.Denim Pencil skirt:

This is my DIY denim skirt at home. I didn't have denim pencil skirt and I couldn't find any good one in stores as well,so decided to cut my husband's old jeans and made this skirt out of it. I wore this skirt with bell sleeves striped top from Shoppers Stop and beige heels from Centro.

6.Denim short skirt:

I think ,every woman must own a denim short skirt as it gives you funky teenager look. These are trendy,cute yet comfortable.

I have this denim short skirt with floral embroidery on it from Forever 21. I paired it with pastel green top from Shoppers Stop. This is off shoulder top but wore it normally on this skirt and teamed this outfit with casual white sneakers.

7. Skorts:

These are skirts with shorts underneath from Ginger Lifestyle. These are cute and most comfortable one.

I wore this skort with plain black 3/4th sleeves top from Code Lifestyle. I don't like to wear prints on prints. So if one is printed I prefer to wear another simple and plain.

So,that's all. These are some of my skirts which I often wear for various occasions. Do let me know which one you like the most. I hope you guys have a great week ahead. XOXO!!
